being shelved (of a movie, project, etc.)

idioms.word: 下戸の建てた蔵はない
idioms.reading: げこのたてたくらはない
idioms.meaning: don't act all high and mighty just because you don't drink

idioms.word: 借りる時の地蔵顔、済す時の閻魔顔
idioms.reading: かりるときのじぞうがお、なすときのえんまがお
idioms.meaning: people look friendly when they ask for a loan but not so much when they repay it

lessons.japanese: 赤い冷蔵庫を見たことがない。
lessons.english: I have never seen a red refrigerator.

lessons.japanese: 赤い冷蔵庫を見たことがない。
lessons.english: I've never seen a red refrigerator.

lessons.japanese: 君は彼の蔵書を利用して良い。
lessons.english: You may make use of his library.

lessons.japanese: 夏は肉が悪くなりやすいから、冷蔵庫にいれておきなさい。
lessons.english: In summer, meat goes bad easily; you must keep it in the refrigerator.

lessons.japanese: 私の蔵書の中のどんな本でも自由に使っていいですよ。
lessons.english: You are welcome to any book in my library.

lessons.japanese: ミルクが少しほしいけど、冷蔵庫には全然ない。
lessons.english: I want some milk, but there isn't any in the refrigerator.

lessons.japanese: その中古の冷蔵庫はひどい代物だった。
lessons.english: That used refrigerator was a real dog.

lessons.japanese: その図書館は多くの書物を所蔵している。
これがごく最近私の蔵書に加わった本です。
lessons.english: This is the latest acquisition to my library.

lessons.japanese: この冷蔵庫を運ぶのに手を貸してよ。
lessons.english: Give me a hand with this refrigerator.
